resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

worklogs.comment:
Tomme commented on pull request #4630: ARROW-3538: [Python] ability to override the automated assignment of uuid for filenames when writing datasets
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4630
 
 
   Implementation for: [ARROW-3538](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-3538).
   Allowing one to overwrite datasets rather than always creating a new copy and/or appending.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.

users@infra.apache.org

wesm commented on issue #4630: ARROW-3538: [Python] ability to override the automated assignment of uuid for filenames when writing datasets
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4630#issuecomment-504081821
 
 
   Seems like the argument should be a callback function of some kind.
   
   Note that this code is on death row pending a C++ rewrite

Tomme commented on issue #4630: ARROW-3538: [Python] ability to override the automated assignment of uuid for filenames when writing datasets
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4630#issuecomment-505401151
 
 
   > Are you open to making the argument a function? The function can be passed the partition keys or something similar

fields.summary: [Python] ability to override the automated assignment of uuid for filenames when writing datasets

comments.body: [~emkornfield@gmail.com] my username [~Tomme], so you can assign.
@wesm @pitrou could you add [~Tomme] as a contributor so this issue can be assigned to him.  I seem to still be missing the bits to do this (or I'm not looking in the right place).
[~emkornfield@gmail.com] I just made you an Administrator in JIRA since you are a PMC member now. So you should be able to modify roles in the JIRA project now
